perturbation.explanation: Changing "shall not be released" to "should not be released to the best of their ability" and "undertakes" to "endeavors" weakens the confidentiality obligation, making it less stringent. This introduces ambiguity regarding the level of effort required to maintain confidentiality. Replacing the phrase "strictly confidential" with "confidential" also minimizes the emphasis on compliance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: New York law regarding trade secrets and confidential information requires a reasonable degree of effort to maintain confidentiality, and this change introduces ambiguity regarding that effort.

perturbation.original_text:
5.1 Governing law:

Pursuant to and in accordance with Section 5-1401 of the New York General Obligations Law, the Parties hereto agree that this Amendment in all respects, and any claim or cause of action based upon or arising out of this Amendment, or any dealing between the Parties relating to the subject matter of this Amendment or the transactions contemplated hereby or the Company/Repairer relationship being established, shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the laws of the State of New York, U.S.A. as applied to contracts to be performed wholly within the State of New York (Exclusive of Section 7-101 of the New York General Obligations Law which is inapplicable to this Amendment).
perturbation.changed_text:
5.1 Governing law:

Pursuant to and possibly in accordance with Section 5-1401 of the New York General Obligations Law, the Parties hereto consider that this Amendment in all respects, and any claim or cause of action based upon or arising out of this Amendment, or any dealing between the Parties relating to the subject matter of this Amendment or the transactions contemplated hereby or the Company/Repairer relationship being established, will be generally guided by, and interpreted with consideration of, the laws of the State of New York, U.S.A. as applied to contracts to be performed wholly within the State of New York (Exclusive of Section 7-101 of the New York General Obligations Law which is inapplicable to this Amendment).
perturbation.explanation: The original clause mandates that New York law *shall* govern and *shall* be construed in accordance with New York law. By changing "Pursuant to and in accordance" to "Pursuant to and possibly in accordance", "agree that" to "consider that," "shall be governed by" to "will be generally guided by," and "construed in accordance with" to "interpreted with consideration of", the legal obligation becomes uncertain. The use of 'possibly,' 'consider,' 'generally guided,' and 'consideration of' introduces ambiguity regarding the extent to which New York law will actually be applied, weakening the governing law provision.
perturbation.contradicted_law: New York General Obligations Law Section 5-1401 allows parties to choose New York law to govern their contracts if the contract involves at least $250,000, but this modification makes it ambiguous whether that choice is actually being made, undermining the certainty the law is intended to provide.

perturbation.explanation: Changing "shall not be released" to "should make an effort not to be released", "undertakes" to "may consider", "to disclose" to "to disclose", "clearly informed such employees of the strictly confidential nature of the Confidential Information" to "attempt to inform such employees of the confidential nature of the Confidential Information", and "shall be responsible for the correct performance of said obligations of confidentiality by its employees" to "will attempt to ensure their employees adhere to said conditions of confidentiality", weakens the confidentiality obligation, making it less stringent. This introduces ambiguity regarding the level of effort required to maintain confidentiality.
perturbation.contradicted_law: New York law regarding trade secrets and confidential information requires a reasonable degree of effort to maintain confidentiality, and this change introduces ambiguity regarding that effort.
